name: Classic Mac and Cheese
steps: Preheat oven to 375Â°F and grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil, showing vigorous bubbles breaking the surface.
Add elbow macaroni to the boiling water and cook for 8-10 minutes until al dente, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Steam should be rising from the pot.
While pasta cooks, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until it foams and becomes fragrant.
Whisk flour into the melted butter continuously for 1 minute, creating a smooth, golden paste called a roux that bubbles gently.
Gradually pour in milk while whisking constantly to prevent lumps, creating a smooth mixture that thickens as it heats and begins to simmer.
Add cream cheese cubes to the milk mixture and whisk until completely melted and incorporated, creating a silky base sauce.
Remove saucepan from heat and gradually stir in grated cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and paprika until the cheese melts into a smooth, glossy sauce.
Drain the cooked pasta thoroughly in a colander, shaking off excess water, then combine with cheese sauce in a large mixing bowl until evenly coated.
Transfer the mac and cheese mixture to the prepared baking dish, spreading it evenly with a spoon so the surface is level.
Mix panko breadcrumbs with 2 tablespoons melted butter until evenly moistened, then sprinkle over the mac and cheese for a golden topping.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the top is golden brown and the edges are bubbling, then remove and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
tips: Use freshly grated cheese for better melting. Don't overcook the pasta as it will continue cooking in the oven. For extra richness, substitute half the milk with heavy cream. Let it rest briefly after baking to set properly.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Classic Mac and Cheese
description: Creamy, cheesy comfort food at its finest
steps: Preheat oven to 375Â°F. Boil large pot of salted water and cook elbow macaroni for 8-10 minutes until al dente, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking
While pasta cooks, melt 4 tablespoons butter in large saucepan over medium heat until bubbling and golden
Whisk flour into melted butter, stirring constantly for 2 minutes to create a golden roux that smells nutty
Slowly pour milk and cream into roux while whisking vigorously to prevent lumps, creating smooth white sauce
Simmer sauce for 3-4 minutes until thickened enough to coat back of spoon, stirring continuously
Remove from heat and gradually stir in grated cheddar and gruyere until completely melted and smooth
Season cheese sauce with salt, pepper, paprika, and cayenne, tasting and adjusting as needed
Drain cooked pasta thoroughly and fold into cheese sauce until every piece is coated
Pour mac and cheese into buttered 9x13 baking dish, spreading evenly with spatula
Melt 2 tablespoons butter and mix with panko breadcrumbs, then sprinkle over top
Bake for 15-20 minutes until top is golden brown and bubbling around edges
tips: Use freshly grated cheese for better melting. Don't overcook pasta as it will continue cooking in oven. Let cool 5 minutes before serving for best texture.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
description: Crispy golden bread with melted cheese inside
steps: Spread softened butter evenly on one side of each bread slice, making sure to cover all edges to prevent sticking
Place one slice butter-side down in a cold pan, then layer the cheese slices evenly on top, leaving small borders around edges
Top with the second bread slice, butter-side up, and gently press down to create contact between all layers
Heat pan over medium-low heat and cook for 3-4 minutes until bottom turns golden brown and crispy, watching for even browning
Carefully flip the sandwich using a spatula, press gently, and cook another 3-4 minutes until second side is golden and cheese is fully melted
Remove from heat, let cool for 1 minute, then slice diagonally with a sharp knife and serve immediately while cheese is still gooey
tips: Use medium-low heat to ensure cheese melts before bread burns. Cover pan with lid for 30 seconds to help cheese melt faster. Let butter soften at room temperature for easier spreading.
author: AI Kitchen

name: BBQ Pulled Pork
description: Tender, smoky pork shoulder slow-cooked to perfection
steps: Mix brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, salt, pepper, and cumin in a bowl to create the dry rub
Pat the pork shoulder completely dry with paper towels, then generously coat all surfaces with the spice rub, massaging it into the meat
Wrap the seasoned pork in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for maximum flavor penetration
Preheat your smoker or oven to 225Â°F, setting up for indirect heat if using a grill
Place the pork shoulder fat-side up on the cooking grate or in a roasting pan, inserting a meat thermometer into the thickest part
Cook low and slow for 6-8 hours until the internal temperature reaches 195-205Â°F and the meat easily shreds with a fork
Remove the pork and wrap tightly in aluminum foil, then let it rest for 30 minutes to redistribute juices
While resting, combine apple cider vinegar, ketchup, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and liquid smoke in a saucepan
Simmer the sauce over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until it thickens slightly
Unwrap the pork and use two forks to shred the meat, discarding excess fat and pulling apart into bite-sized pieces
Mix the shredded pork with enough BBQ sauce to coat well, reserving extra sauce for serving
Serve the pulled pork on toasted hamburger buns with coleslaw and additional BBQ sauce on the side
tips: The pork is done when it reaches 195-205Â°F internal temperature and shreds easily. If the outside gets too dark, wrap in foil partway through cooking. Let the meat rest before shredding to retain moisture. Save the cooking juices to mix with the sauce for extra flavor.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Classic Hamburger
description: Juicy beef patty with fresh toppings on a bun
steps: Divide ground beef into 4 equal portions and gently shape into patties slightly larger than buns, creating a small indent in center with thumb to prevent puffing during cooking
Season both sides of patties generously with salt and pepper, then let them rest at room temperature for 10 minutes while heating grill or pan
Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering, or preheat grill to medium-high temperature
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes on first side without pressing down, until edges begin to brown and juices start to surface
Flip patties carefully with spatula and cook for another 3-4 minutes, placing cheese slices on top during last minute of cooking
Meanwhile, slice tomato into 1/4-inch thick rounds, separate onion into rings, and lightly toast hamburger buns cut-side down in dry pan until golden
Spread mayonnaise on bottom bun, layer with lettuce leaf, cooked patty with melted cheese, tomato slice, onion rings, and pickle
Add dollops of ketchup and mustard on top bun, then crown the burger and serve immediately while hot
tips: Don't overwork the meat when forming patties to keep them tender. Let patties rest before cooking and avoid pressing them down while cooking to retain juices. Toast buns for better texture and to prevent sogginess.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Buffalo Wings
description: Crispy chicken wings in spicy buffalo sauce
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken wings, split into flats and drumettes
steps: Pat chicken wings completely dry with paper towels and let them sit at room temperature for 30 minutes - moisture is the enemy of crispy skin
Heat vegetable oil to 375Â°F in a large pot or deep fryer, using enough oil to fully submerge wings
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika until evenly combined
Toss the dried wings in the flour mixture, shaking off excess coating so each wing has a light, even dusting
Carefully lower wings into hot oil in small batches, frying for 10-12 minutes until golden brown and internal temperature reaches 165Â°F
Remove wings with a slotted spoon and drain on a wire rack set over paper towels for 2-3 minutes
In a small saucepan, melt butter over low heat, then whisk in hot sauce, vinegar, garlic powder, and cayenne until smooth and emulsified
Transfer hot wings to a large bowl, pour buffalo sauce over them, and toss vigorously until every wing is completely coated in glossy orange sauce
Serve immediately on a platter with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing while wings are still hot and crispy
tips: Double-fry for extra crispiness: fry once at 350Â°F for 8 minutes, rest for 5 minutes, then fry again at 375Â°F for 4-5 minutes. Make sure wings are completely dry before coating, and don't overcrowd the fryer to maintain oil temperature.
author: AI Kitchen

name: New England Clam Chowder
description: Creamy, hearty soup with tender clams and potatoes
ingredients: 3 medium Yukon potatoes, peeled and cubed
Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Place clams and water in large pot, cover and bring to boil over high heat. Steam for 8-10 minutes until clams open wide, shaking pot occasionally. Remove opened clams with tongs, discard any that remain closed.
Strain clam broth through fine-mesh strainer lined with cheesecloth into bowl, reserve liquid. Remove clam meat from shells, chop into bite-sized pieces, and set aside in refrigerator.
In same large pot, cook diced bacon over medium heat for 5-6 minutes, stirring frequently until crispy and golden brown. Fat should be rendered and bacon pieces crackling.
Add chopped onion and celery to bacon fat, cook for 4-5 minutes stirring constantly until vegetables are soft and translucent but not browned.
Sprinkle flour over vegetable mixture, stir continuously for 2 minutes to create a light roux that coats vegetables and eliminates raw flour taste.
Gradually whisk in reserved clam broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Add cubed potatoes, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to gentle simmer.
Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer uncovered for 15-20 minutes until potatoes are fork-tender and easily pierced. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Slowly pour in heavy cream while stirring gently. Add chopped clams and butter, simmer for 3-4 minutes until heated through. Do not boil or clams will become tough.
Remove bay leaves, season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls, garnish with fresh chives and serve immediately with crackers.
tips: Never boil the chowder after adding cream to prevent curdling. Fresh clams are essential - frozen won't give the same briny flavor. Make chowder a day ahead as flavors improve overnight, just reheat gently without boiling.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Mapo Tofu
description: Spicy Sichuan tofu in savory sauce
ingredients: 14 oz silken tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 green onions, chopped (whites and greens separated)
2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 3 tablespoons water
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. The oil should shimmer and move freely when the pan is tilted.
Add ground meat and cook for 3-4 minutes, breaking it apart with a spatula until it's browned and crumbly with no pink remaining.
Push meat to one side of the pan and add doubanjiang to the empty space. Stir-fry the paste for 30 seconds until fragrant and darkened.
Add minced garlic, ginger, and white parts of green onions. Stir everything together and cook for 1 minute until aromatic.
Pour in broth, soy sauce, and sugar. Bring the mixture to a gentle boil with small bubbles breaking the surface.
Carefully slide tofu cubes into the sauce. Gently shake the pan instead of stirring to avoid breaking the tofu. Simmer for 3-4 minutes.
Stir the cornstarch slurry and slowly drizzle it into the sauce while gently moving the pan. The sauce should thicken and coat the tofu glossily.
Remove from heat and drizzle with sesame oil. Sprinkle ground Sichuan peppercorns, white pepper, and green onion tops over the dish.
tips: Use silken tofu for authentic texture but handle gently. Toast whole Sichuan peppercorns in a dry pan before grinding for maximum numbing effect. Adjust spice level by varying doubanjiang amount.
author: AI Kitchen

name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: Spicy Sichuan stir-fry with chicken and peanuts
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, diced into 1/2-inch cubes
1 tablespoon rice wine or dry sherry
steps: Marinate diced chicken in 1 tablespoon soy sauce, rice wine, and cornstarch for 15 minutes until pieces are evenly coated and slightly glossy
Heat wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking, add vegetable oil and swirl to coat the surface completely
Add marinated chicken pieces in single layer, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown and cooked through with crispy edges
Push chicken to one side of wok, add dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns to empty space, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant and chilies darken
Add minced garlic and ginger to aromatics, stir everything together for 30 seconds until fragrant steam rises from wok
Pour in remaining soy sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar, and black vinegar, toss rapidly for 1 minute until sauce coats chicken and sizzles
Add roasted peanuts and green onions, stir-fry for final 1-2 minutes until onions are bright green and slightly wilted
Remove from heat, drizzle with sesame oil, and toss once more before serving immediately over steamed rice
tips: Toast Sichuan peppercorns in dry pan before using for extra flavor. Adjust chili amount for desired heat level. Have all ingredients prepped before cooking as stir-frying happens very quickly.
author: AI Kitchen
